publicFQDN.label: Public FQDN
publicFQDN.help: Your public FQDN or IP address. Requests to port 443 on this address must be received by this Adapter on the address/port configured below. Usually achieved through port forwarding/firewall configuration.

port.label: Listen port
port.help:
Connections from the Internet to port 443 of FQDN must arrive here.
Setup your firewall/port forwarding/proxy appropriately.

useSsl.label: Use ioBroker SSL certificates
useSsl.help:
If traffic is arriving from the Internet via port forwarding then this must be checked and a certificate appropriate for public FQDN must be available. Use the ACME adapter to generate one automatically.
If a reverse proxy with SSL offloading is in use then SSL is not mandatory, but if checked a certificate collection matching the request host must exist.

homeGraphJSONKey.label: Google HomeGraph JSON Key
homeGraphJSONKey.help: Create a Service Account Key for your project and copy/paste the JSON here.
homeGraphJSONKey.validatorErrorText: Google HomeGraph JSON Key must be specified

oauthClientId.label: OAuth Client ID
oauthClientId.help: Client ID configured in the Account Linking section of your Actions on Google Console.
oauthClientId.validatorErrorText: OAuth Client ID must be specified

oauthClientSecret.label: OAuth Client Secret
oauthClientSecret.help: Client Secret configured in the Account Linking section of your Actions on Google Console.
oauthClientSecret.validatorErrorText: OAuth Client Secret must be specified

_.text: Enable each plugin for which you would like the related ioBroker states to be exposed in Google Home.

pluginsLoxoneExcludeFunctions.label: Exclude functions
pluginsLoxoneExcludeFunctions.help: Devices having excluded functions will not be exposed to Google Home.

pluginsLoxoneExcludeRooms.label: Exclude rooms
pluginsLoxoneExcludeRooms.help: Devices in excluded rooms will not be exposed to Google Home.

pluginsLoxoneSceneReversible.label: Reversible scenes
pluginsLoxoneSceneReversible.help: If checked, requesting a lighting scene mixes that scene in and thus a request to deactivate can be made to mix a scene out. If left unchecked scene requests result in only that scene being activated.
